body:
Hi there !

Been playing around with helmv3 and found next problem.

i've got a CRD template that locates in `templates` folder and named as `crd.yaml` with next content
```
{{ if .Values.crd.create }}
apiVersion: apiextensions.k8s.io/v1beta1
kind: CustomResourceDefinition
metadata:
  name: testservices.test.com
spec:
  scope: Namespaced
  group: test.com
  names:
    kind: testService
    listKind: testServiceList
    plural: testservices
    shortNames:
    - test
    - tests
    singular: testservice
  version: v1
  versions:
  - name: v1
    served: true
    storage: true
{{ end }}
```

Output of `helm version`:
```
$ helm version
version.BuildInfo{Version:"v3.0.0-beta.4", GitCommit:"7ffc879f137bd3a69eea53349b01f05e3d1d2385", GitTreeState:"dirty", GoVersion:"go1.13.1"}
```

Output of `kubectl version`:
```
$ kubectl version
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"11", GitVersion:"v1.11.0", GitCommit:"91e7b4fd31fcd3d5f436da26c980becec37ceefe", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2018-06-27T20:17:28Z", GoVersion:"go1.10.2", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"11+", GitVersion:"v1.11.0+d4cacc0", GitCommit:"d4cacc0", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-01-29T15:19:24Z", GoVersion:"go1.10.3", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```

`helm template . --kubeconfig /home/me/.kube/config` fails with next error:
```
Error: apiVersion "apiextensions.k8s.io/v1beta1" in crd.yaml is not available
``` 

`kubectl` says, that i can create CRD on the cluster:
```
$ kubectl --kubeconfig /home/me/.kube/config auth can-i create crd
yes
```
 
templating of non cluster wide resources are working fine

Cloud Provider/Platform (AKS, GKE, Minikube etc.): 
Openshift 3.11

title: Helm v3 can not template CRD
